revised_title: On the Stimulation and Secretion Mechanisms in Drosera dichotoma's Tentacles
tldr: This study investigates the histological changes and mechanisms in the tentacles of Drosera dichotoma, a carnivorous plant, during stimulation and secretion. The author examines the role of gland-cells, the structure of the tentacles, and the cellular responses to various stimuli, such as heat, moisture, and food, providing insights into the plant's feeding and trapping mechanisms.
